description: Visualization of the dual function as the lower envelope of affine functions. For each fixed x, the Lagrangian L(x, λ) is a line in λ-space with slope f(x) and intercept f₀(x). The dual function g(λ) = inf_x L(x, λ) is the lower envelope—always concave regardless of primal convexity.

Diagram showing the duality gap. The primal optimal value p* sits above the dual optimal value d*. The gap p* - d* is zero under strong duality (Slater's condition for convex problems). For nonconvex problems, the gap may be positive.

Geometric interpretation of KKT conditions. At the optimum x*, the negative gradient of the objective lies in the cone generated by active constraint gradients. Complementary slackness: inactive constraints have zero multipliers (no force).

Illustration of strong duality in the trust-region problem despite nonconvexity. The quadratic objective x^T A x + 2b^T x is minimized over the unit ball. Even when A is not PSD, the 1D dual problem solves the primal exactly.
